What are the various steps taken by government of India towards the Nuclear Non-proliferation?
  1. adopted a no first use policy whereby it has pledged to not to use nuclear weapons unless first attacked
  2. placed a self-imposed moratorium on nuclear tests
  3. signed and ratified the Nuclear Non-proliferation Treaty
  4. does not allow the transfer of Nuclear Weapons Technology to other nations
  5. has placed all its nuclear power plants under inspection of IAEA
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: adopted a no first use policy whereby it has pledged to not to use nuclear weapons unless first attacked This is correct. India has adopted a no-first use policy placed a self-imposed moratorium on nuclear tests This is correct, India self-imposed a moratorium after 1998 Pokharan Tests. signed and ratified the Nuclear Non-proliferation Treaty This is incorrect. India has not signed or ratified the NPT. does not allow the transfer of Nuclear Weapons Technology to other nations This is correct and Indiaâ€™s policy towards nuclear technology. has placed all its nuclear power plants under inspection of IAEA This is incorrect because not all power plants but only 22 and recently four more placed under IAEA.
